com.ibm.xmi.framework
Class DeclarationFactory

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.xmi.framework.DeclarationFactory
public class DeclarationFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This class converts XMI objects from UML 1.1 XMI 1.0 files to framework declarations. In the framework object model, a framework declaration is either a package, a class, or a feature of a class.

You can obtain the XMI objects by using the load method for an XMIFile or XMIFiles object, then invoking the getObjects method of the returned XMIFile object.

It is not the purpose of this class to give you access to all of the data from a UML model. This class simply gets the data from a UML model that corresponds to the framework object model; it ignores all other parts of the UML model.

For each package in the UML model, the framework creates a framework package. For each class in the UML model, the framework creates a framework class. For each attribute in the UML model, the framework creates a feature. The type of the feature is the type of the UML attribute. For each association end in the UML model that is navigable, the framework creates a feature also.

The containment of packages in the UML model is reflected by the framework packages. The containment of classes inside packages in the UML model is reflected in the framework classes and packages.

The inheritance of classes in the UML model is reflected in the framework classes.

The type of the attributes in the UML model determines the types of the features the framework makes for them. If the attribute type is a primitive, the framework makes a feature whose value type is Value.DATA and whose type is the datatype for the attribute; if the attribute type is a UML enumeration, the framework makes a feature whose type is an Enum and whose value type is Value.ENUM, and if the attribute type is a class in the UML model, the framework makes a feature whose value type is Value.OBJECT and whose type is the type of the UML attribute type.

The framework makes association ends based on the value of the aggregation attribute of the corresponding UML association end. For example, if an association end is "composite", the framework makes a feature whose value type is Value.CONTAINED and a feature whose value type is Value.CONTAINER for the opposite association end. If an association end is not composite, and its opposite association end is not composite either, the framework makes a feature whose value type is Value.REFERENCE for it.

The framework assigns XMI names to the framework declarations based on the names in the UML model; currently, it is your responsibility to ensure that the names in the UML model are valid XMI names, that is, they do not contain characters that are illegal characters for XML attribute names and XML tag names.

The framework sets the XMI source of each declaration to its corresponding XMI object, and it sets the XMI defined property of each XMI object to the corresponding declaration. For instance, when an XMI class is created from an XMI object corresponding to a class in the UML model, the XMI source of the XMI class is set to the object, and the XMI defined property of the object is set to the XMI class.

Method Detail

getFullName

public java.lang.String getFullName(XMIObject object,
                                    int owners)
Return the full name of the object, if owners is 1000; otherwise, return the name of the object with the given number of owners, separated by ".".
Parameters:
object - A Java object representing an XMI object in your domain.
owners - The number of owner names to include in the full name
Returns:
The full name of the object consisting of the given number of owner names

makeDeclarations

public java.util.Collection makeDeclarations(java.util.Iterator objects)
Returns an unmodifiable collection of framework declarations based on the XMI objects from a UML 1.1 XMI 1.0 file. The packages and classes in the returned collection are the top level ones.

Framework declarations are packages, classes, properties of classes, and links of classes.

Parameters:
objects - An iterator for a collection of XMI objects from a UML 1.1 XMI 1.0 file.
Returns:
An unmodifiable collection of the top level framework packages and classes from the UML model.

makeDeclarations

public java.util.Collection makeDeclarations(XMIContainer container)
Returns an unmodifiable collection of framework declarations based on the XMI objects from a UML 1.1 XMI 1.0 file that are in the given container. The framework packages and classes in the returned collection are the top level ones.

Framework declarations are packages, classes, properties of classes, and links of classes.

Returns:
An unmodifiable collection of framework declarations

register

public void register(java.lang.String namespaceName,
                     java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                     java.lang.String top)
Create each namespace and put them in the nameToNamespace hashtable.
